titleStmt.title: Alexander P. Lacey et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9466

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Perry County
To His Excellency
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens of Perry county would respectfully represent that at the May Term of Perry Cirucit Court One John Gambrill who is now confined in state prisoner was tried and convicted Now we do sincerely hope and beg your Excellency to pardon said Gambrill: Gambrill it is reported has been a man of bad character But for late years he has to a great extent redeemed that character And ^we^knowing the fact that the Main witness William Gullett to bea man of notorious bad character and Knowing something of the charcter of testimony upon which Gambrill was convicted: And knowing the many undue advantages taken by is Enemies in the trial And further knowing the fact that Gambrill was an industrious and energetic man toiling and laboring to support a lovely wife and seven small children being reputably convicted and knowing that it woulda pardon would meet with the entire approval of is fellow citizens We We would humbly
ask your Excellency to grant unto John Gambrill a pardon and again restore him to the bosom of his friends and family
